statements: SELECT * FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings;
SELECT customer_id, rating FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT customer_id, rating, feedback FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE feedback IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT customer_id, feedback FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings ORDER BY customer_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE rating > 3 ORDER BY customer_id DESC, rating ASC
SELECT customer_id, rating FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE feedback LIKE '%Excellent%'
SELECT AVG(rating) AS avg_rating, COUNT(*) AS total_ratings FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings
SELECT customer_id, rating FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings ORDER BY rating DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT customer_id, feedback FROM customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE feedback IS NOT NULL
SELECT * FROM CustomerSatisfaction;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE satisfaction_rating > 4;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating, comments FROM CustomerSatisfaction ORDER BY satisfaction_rating DESC;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE customer_id = 3;
SELECT customer_id, comments FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE comments IS NOT NULL;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating, comments FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3 ORDER BY satisfaction_rating DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating, comments FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE satisfaction_rating < 3 ORDER BY customer_id ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating, comments FROM CustomerSatisfaction WHERE satisfaction_rating = 5 AND LENGTH(comments) > 10 ORDER BY customer_id DESC LIMIT 5;

SELECT A.customer_id, A.improvement_area, C.satisfaction_rating FROM AreasForImprovement A JOIN CustomerSatisfaction C ON A.customer_id = C.customer_id WHERE C.satisfaction_rating < 3 ORDER BY A.customer_id ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT C.customer_id, C.satisfaction_rating, A.improvement_area FROM CustomerSatisfaction C LEFT JOIN AreasForImprovement A ON C.customer_id = A.customer_id ORDER BY C.customer_id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM Customer_satisfaction_ratings;
SELECT customer_id, rating FROM Customer_satisfaction_ratings ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT feedback_text FROM Customer_feedback WHERE feedback_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM Customer_details WHERE customer_id = 100;
SELECT * FROM Customer_details ORDER BY customer_name ASC, customer_id DESC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM Customer_details;
SELECT customer_id, rating FROM Customer_satisfaction_ratings WHERE rating > 4.5;
SELECT feedback_text, feedback_date FROM Customer_feedback ORDER BY feedback_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_phone FROM Customer_details WHERE customer_phone IS NOT NULL;
SELECT customer_name, feedback_text FROM Customer_details JOIN Customer_feedback ON Customer_details.customer_id = Customer_feedback.customer_id;
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating, feedback FROM customer_ratings
SELECT product_name, price FROM products
SELECT order_id, customer_id, product_id, order_date FROM orders
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees
SELECT customer_id, satisfaction_rating FROM customer_ratings WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3
SELECT * FROM customer_ratings WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT customer_id, feedback FROM customer_ratings WHERE feedback LIKE '%improve%';
SELECT product_id, product_name, price FROM products WHERE price > 100 ORDER BY price DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT order_id, product_name, order_date FROM orders o JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.product_id WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30' ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales' OR department = 'Marketing' ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT customer_id, name, email, address FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_rating < 3 ORDER BY satisfaction_rating DESC;
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT product_id, name, price FROM products WHERE category = 'Electronics';
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email, satisfaction_rating FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3 ORDER BY satisfaction_rating DESC;
SELECT p.name as product_name, p.price as product_price, r.rating as product_rating FROM products p JOIN reviews r ON p.product_id = r.product_id ORDER BY r.rating DESC;
SELECT c.name as customer_name, SUM(p.total_amount) as total_spent FROM customers c JOIN purchases p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id GROUP BY c.name ORDER BY total_spent DESC;
SELECT d.name as department_name, m.name as manager_name FROM departments d LEFT JOIN customers m ON d.manager_id = m.customer_id;
